text: Aafia Siddiqui (; born 2 March 1972) is a Pakistani neuroscientist. She was convicted of multiple felonies. She was born in Karachi, Sindh, Pakistan. She is serving an 86-year sentence at the Federal Medical Center, Carswell in Fort Worth, Texas, United States. She is viewed by some people in Pakistan as the "national symbol of honor". The Pakistani news media have called her trial a "farce" and very politically motivated. ==References== Category:1972 births Category:Living people Category:Pakistani Muslims Category:Pakistani scientists Category:People convicted of attempted murder Category:People from Karachi Category:Prisoners Category:Neuroscientists Category:Pakistani criminals
title: Aafia Siddiqui
